Exaggerate: The claim that Texas is growing twice as fast as the rest of the country may be an exaggeration as the growth rate of Texas is not exactly double that of the rest of the nation.
Lack enough support: The claim may lack enough support as the expert mentions that the latest data available at the time of the claim was released in 2015, and more recent data may provide a different perspective on the growth rate.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that comparing Texas to the rest of the nation (excluding Texas) is an accurate representation of its growth rate compared to the entire country. This assumption may be problematic as it does not consider the growth rates of individual states.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert mentions that while Texas may not be the fastest-growing state, it still experienced significant population growth. This suggests that there may be alternative explanations for Texas' growth rate compared to the rest of the country.
